intro: Leucadendron splendens, commonly known as the silverleaf candle bush, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its striking, cone-shaped yellow flowers that bloom in spring. The plant has narrow, silvery-green leaves that give it its common name, and it is often cultivated for its ornamental value. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for coastal and Mediterranean climates. Leucadendron splendens is also valued for its ability to attract birds and insects, contributing to local biodiversity.
